title: William Easterly on Growth, Poverty, and Aid
description: William Easterly of NYU talks about why some nations escape poverty while others do not, why aid almost always fails to create growth, and what can realistically be done to help the poorest people in the world.
author: webmaster@econlib.org (EconTalk: Russ Roberts)
content:encoded: William Easterly of NYU talks about why some nations escape poverty while others do not, why aid almost always fails to create growth, and what can realistically be done to help the poorest people in the world.
